results.title: Witches' brew
results.creator_credit: Donna Ashbrook, Joshua Lightman Company, Richard Shorr and Herbert L. Strock
results.brief_description: A mesmerising tale of magic, power struggles and betrayal. Margaret, Linda and Susan are three housewives using witchcraft to further the careers of their husbands. When Margaret’s husband Joshua jeers at her claims that her magic has enhanced his life, she decides to teach him a lesson by removing her spells and renouncing her “hobby”. Soon after, Joshua experiences an amazing run of bad luck, heightened by the evil intentions of Linda and Susan, who have their own reasons for eliminating him. Margaret’s only hope seems to be the head witch, Vivian, played by screen veteran Lana Turner, but does she want to help, or does she have an ulterior motive? Filmed as a black comedy send up of the British film, “Burn, Witch, Burn” (1962), and adapted from Fritz Leiber’s novel, “Conjure Wife”.

results.title: Witch hunt
results.brief_description: Presented by George Donikan, this documentary is a “Four Corners” style investigation into the so-called Greek Social Security Conspiracy Fraud. The whole story of the scandal and the role of the Federal Police and the Department of Social Security is explored in this documentary.

results.title: Witch doctor
results.brief_description: Choreographic interpretation of voodoo ritual performed by Haitian witch doctor, danced by Jean Leon Destine, to rid a woman possessed of an eil spirit. Accompanied by music of drums.

results.title: Wise woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hannan Kuea
results.brief_description: Hannan’s grandmother was a wise woman and a great storyteller who would tell Hannan ghost stories as a young girl in Sudan. This story was produced in association with the Craig Family Centre and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: Wise blood
results.creator_credit: Ithaca Prod, Michael Fitzgerald, Kathy Fitzgerald and John Huston
results.brief_description: Flannery O’Connor’s first novel was a mesmerising and almost hallucinigenic satire of deep-South Christian fundamentalism. This masterful film by John Huston, directed late in his career, is one of his finest works. Brad Dourif plays an alienated young ex-serviceman who wishes to create a new form of Church which preaches religion without salvation. On his perverse Pilgrim’s Progress through the underbelly of the Southern United States, he is taken up as a religious saviour by a range of unscrupulous con-men who are only to willing to exploit him for financial gain. Absurd and blackly comic, “Wise Blood” paints a disturbing picture of the twisted relationship between religion and politics in the United States. Released on the eve of Reagan’s election to President, this film questions the combination of religious hysteria, unashamed materialism and deliberate ignorance of fundamentalism.

results.title: Wisconsin: the good life
results.creator_credit: Dick Durrance Films and Dick Durrance
results.brief_description: A survey of Wisconsin - touches briefly the story of the States and the present agricultural and industrial riches. Shows scenes of Milwaukee, an ocean-going port in the heart of the mid-west; Madison, the capital and centre of public life and the varied opportunities for winter and summer sports.

results.title: Wirritt wirritt [Italian version]: an Australian legend
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian news and Information Bureau and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Wirritt Wirritt
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Australian news and Information Bureau and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: The aboriginal legend of how fire came under man’s control, illustrated by aboriginal cave painting. The musical background was recorded in Arnhem Land by Professor Elkin. The story is that at first only one man could make fire, and jealously guarded it. However, by a trick Wirritt Wirritt (an ancestral hero) stole the secret for all men’s use. Narrated by Ray Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board, Australian news and Information Bureau and Malcolm Otton

results.title: Wireless nights
results.creator_credit: Chris McGill, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Melissa Juhanson
results.brief_description: Each night from midnight to dawn Melbourne’s night owls and insomniacs tune their radios to the voice 3AW’s Keith McGowan. “Wireless nights” explores the richness and drama of this unique group of people, self-named “The Overnighters”, as they share their lives across the airwaves.

results.title: Wireless nights
results.brief_description: For older lonely people, talk back radio is both a solace and a connection to the wilder world. This luminous documentary concentrates on people’s faces and the living rooms, kitchens and bedrooms in which they live to create a blessedly humane mediation on age, loneliness and technology.
